title: Are there cavemen in heaven? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Bible does not use the term “caveman” or “Neanderthals,” and according to the Bible there is no such thing as “prehistoric” man. The term “prehistoric” means “belonging to the era before recorded history.” It presupposes that the biblical account is merely a fabrication, because the book of Genesis records events which precede the creation of man (namely, the first five days of creation—man was created on the sixth day). The Bible is clear that Adam and Eve were perfect humans from the time of their creation and did not evolve from lower life forms. With that said, the Bible does describe a period of traumatic upheaval upon the earth—the flood (Genesis 6-9), during which time civilization was utterly destroyed except for eight people. Humanity was forced to start over. It is in this historical context that some scholars believe men lived in caves and made use of stone tools. These men were not primitive; they were simply destitute. And they certainly were not half ape. The fossil evidence is quite clear: cavemen were human—men who lived in caves. There are some fossilized ape remains which Darwinian paleo-anthropologists interpret as being some sort of transition between ape and men. Most people seem to think of these interpretations when they imagine cavemen. They picture furry half-men, half-ape creatures crouched in a cave next to a fire, drawing on the walls with their newly developed stone tools. This is a common misconception. And as far as Darwinian paleo-anthropology goes, we should keep in mind that these interpretations reflect a peculiar worldview and are not the result of the evidence. In fact, not only is there major opposition to these interpretations within the academic community, the Darwinists themselves do not entirely agree with each other on the details. Unfortunately, the popular mainstream view promotes this idea that man and ape both evolved from the same ancestor, but this is certainly not the only plausible interpretation of the available evidence. In fact, the evidence in favor of this particular interpretation is lacking. When God created Adam and Eve, they were fully developed human beings, capable of communication, society, and development (Genesis 2:19-25; 3:1-20; 4:1-12). It is almost entertaining to consider the lengths evolutionary scientists go to prove the existence of prehistoric cavemen. They find a misshapen tooth in a cave and from that create a misshapen human being who lived in a cave, hunched over like an ape. There is no way that science can prove the existence of cavemen by a fossil. Evolutionary scientists simply have a theory, and then they force the evidence to fit the theory. Adam and Eve were the first human beings ever created and were fully-formed, intelligent, and upright. What does the Bible say about cavemen, prehistoric men, neanderthals?

Haha… Are there vegetarians in heaven? Are there truck drivers in heaven? There are ‘cavemen’ (and women) today who live quite comfortably in caves. Do you think God would exclude someone from heaven based on where they live? No! But of course the question is referring to cavemen from the past, such as Neandertals. These people were descendants of Adam and Eve. They had a sin nature the same as you and I. If they trusted in Jesus Christ as their Savior, they are brothers and sisters in the Lord, who will be with us in eternity.

I don’t remember reading about Adam and Eve building a house. They may very well have lived in caves. Their children may also have lived in caves. When mankind began to build dwellings is not mentioned in the Bible, so there may very well have been many generations of cave-dwellers in Hebrew prehistory. But then again, ancient Hebrews didn’t believe in heaven or hell, and we still have no evidence these places actually exist.

I’ll help you answer your own question! Do you believe that heaven exists? If not, then it’s pointless to even try to answer this question. If so, what it is? Who’s there? What must one do to enter heaven after death? What, in your opinion, are “cavemen”? Are they humans, or proto-humans, or sub-humans? How would you define them? Now you have all the information you need to answer the question.
Hi… I don’t believe there are any as I don’t believe the “caveman” ever existed. What does the Bible say about cavemen, prehistoric men, neanderthals? Regards…

I am not an expert on cavemen, but the Urantia Book dates the first parents to 1 million years ago and they are in heaven, and we have spoken with them many times. So it depends where your “cavemen” fit into the timeline.

Some people lived in caves because it was convenient since it provided shelter from the elements. I don’t subscribe to the idea that we evolved from apes. But hypothetically if said men who lived in caves believed in Jesus as savior, then in the future they will be in heaven.
Yes, they live in caves in the clouds and draw pictures of angels on the walls.
